Key Match Events: New Zealand (200-3) beat Australia (111) by 89 runs.
Josh Hazlewood took a top edge from Glenn Phillips and completed the catch.
David Warner edged Trent Boult for a boundary before deflecting a Tim Southee delivery onto his stumps.
Aaron Finch and Mitchell Marsh were dismissed by New Zealand bowlers.
Glenn Maxwell scored 28 runs in quick time.
Tim Southee claimed three wickets for six runs from 13 deliveries.
Trent Boult finished with two wickets for 24 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway remarked that Finn Allen's fearless play complemented his own game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand outclassed hosts Australia in the Super 12 opener of the T20 World Cup 2022.
New Zealand now have the upper hand in the group stage, and Australia needs to find a way to beat the English favourites.
